pullrequest.title: A road is not a Model, but is a child of the world. This will cause a crash when accessing model by index.

content.html:
This loop seems to have slightly incorrect logic to me. If _index = 0, then it will return the first child, without actually checking to see if it HasType(Base::MODEL). I would try:

for (unsigned int i=0, count=0;
     i < this->rootElement->GetChildCount(); i++)
{
  if (this->rootElement->GetChild(i)->HasType(Base::MODEL)
  {
    if (count == _index)
    {
      model = boost::shared_static_cast<Model>(
          this->rootElement->GetChild(count));
      break;
    }
    count++;
  }
}

content.raw: Even with the fix below, gazebo still crashes for me when running `gazebo sdf/worlds/road.world`. I approve of this pull request, though I don't think it fully fixes roads.

content.raw: Can you post the crash info?

pullrequest.title: A road is not a Model, but is a child of the world. This will cause a crash when accessing model by index.

content.raw:
My procedure is `gdb gzserver`, then `r sdf/worlds/road.world`, then `gdb gzclient` in a separate terminal. The client and server start fine, though I don't see the ground plane or a road in the render window, just the sky ([see screenshot](http://dl.dropbox.com/u/96660379/road%20render%20problem.png)). I add a unit box to the world, and gzserver aborts. Here's the backtrace:

content.html:
My procedure is gdb gzserver, then r sdf/worlds/road.world, then gdb gzclient in a separate terminal. The client and server start fine, though I don't see the ground plane or a road in the render window, just the sky (see screenshot). I add a unit box to the world, and gzserver aborts. Here's the backtrace:

pullrequest.title: A road is not a Model, but is a child of the world. This will cause a crash when accessing model by index.

content.raw: I just realized I made an error in my suggested patch. I've made a new comment below.
content.html: I just realized I made an error in my suggested patch. I've made a new comment below.

pullrequest.title: A road is not a Model, but is a child of the world. This will cause a crash when accessing model by index.

content.raw:
I made an error in my recommended loop. This line should be:
~~~
this->rootElement->GetChild(i));
~~~
content.html:
I made an error in my recommended loop. This line should be:

this->rootElement->GetChild(i));

pullrequest.title: A road is not a Model, but is a child of the world. This will cause a crash when accessing model by index.

content.raw:
Thanks.

It's interesting that this would cause a segfault for you but not for me. I was able to add many shapes, and robots and never experienced a crash.
content.html:
Thanks.

It's interesting that this would cause a segfault for you but not for me. I was able to add many shapes, and robots and never experienced a crash.

pullrequest.title: A road is not a Model, but is a child of the world. This will cause a crash when accessing model by index.

content.raw: I think the crashes will resolved by my comment below. As a separate issue, I don't see the ground plane or a road rendering in the client. I see simple objects that I add, but not the road or ground plane.
content.html: I think the crashes will resolved by my comment below. As a separate issue, I don't see the ground plane or a road rendering in the client. I see simple objects that I add, but not the road or ground plane.

pullrequest.title: A road is not a Model, but is a child of the world. This will cause a crash when accessing model by index.

content.raw: The ground plane is purposefully turned off, look in the `road.sdf` file. The road doesn't show up because of a transport problem, see pull request #196
content.html: The ground plane is purposefully turned off, look in the road.sdf file. The road doesn't show up because of a transport problem, see pull request #196
